definition: to double the degree, having two meanings with intent to deceive, a base hit on which the batter stops safely at second base, increase twofold
details:
adverb
- to double the degree
= synonyms: twice
- two together
= example: two together
- downward and forward
= example: downward and forward
adjective
- having two meanings with intent to deceive
= example: having two meanings with intent to deceive
= synonyms: forked
- large enough for two
= example: large enough for two
- used of homologous chromosomes associated in pairs in synapsis
= synonyms: bivalent
- twice as great or many
= example: twice as great or many
= synonyms: twofold, doubled, two-fold
- consisting of or involving two parts or components usually in pairs
= example: consisting of or involving two parts or components usually in pairs
= synonyms: dual, duple
- having more than one decidedly dissimilar aspects or qualities
= example: having more than one decidedly dissimilar aspects or qualities
= synonyms: threefold, twofold, treble, dual, two-fold, three-fold
- used of flowers having more than the usual number of petals in crowded or overlapping arrangements
= example: used of flowers having more than the usual number of petals in crowded or overlapping arrangements
noun
- a base hit on which the batter stops safely at second base
= example: a base hit on which the batter stops safely at second base
= synonyms: two-bagger
- raising the stakes in a card game by a factor of 2
= example: raising the stakes in a card game by a factor of 2
= synonyms: doubling
- a quantity that is twice as great as another
= example: a quantity that is twice as great as another
- someone who closely resembles a famous person, especially an actor
= example: someone who closely resembles a famous person, especially an actor
= synonyms: look-alike, image
- a stand-in for movie stars to perform dangerous stunts
= example: a stand-in for movie stars to perform dangerous stunts
= synonyms: stunt man, stunt woman
verb
- increase twofold
= example: increase twofold
= synonyms: duplicate
- hit a two-base hit
- do double duty
- make or do or perform again
= synonyms: duplicate, repeat, reduplicate, replicate
- bend over or curl up, usually with laughter or pain
= example: bend over or curl up, usually with laughter or pain
= synonyms: double up, double over
- bridge: make a demand for (a card or suit)
